item.name: Conflicted applications are detected: keyboard device
Conflicted applications are detected: pointing device
Don't remap non-Apple's keyboards
item.appendix: (For example: Generic USB keyboard)

item.name: Don't remap non-Apple's pointing devices
item.appendix: (For example: Generic USB mouse)

item.name: Don't remap keyboards which has third vendor's driver
item.appendix: (Logitech, Microsoft, Kensington, ...)

item.name: Don't remap pointing devices which has third vendor's driver
item.appendix: (Logitech, Microsoft, Kensington, ...)

item.name: Disable an internal keyboard while external keyboards are connected.
Disable an internal keyboard while external keyboards are connected.
item.appendix: Note for Logitech Unifying Receiver users:
The receiver is detected as a composite device of keyboard and mouse.
So, the receiver always disables an internal keyboard even if you are using only mouse.
If you are not using Unifying keyboard devices, please enable a following option.

item.name: Treat Logitech Unifying Receiver as pointing device.
Ignore devices that do not have valid Vendor ID and Product ID.
item.appendix: (Vendor ID == 0x0000 and Product ID == 0x0000)

item.name: Don't leave any modes automatically when the machine wakes from sleep.
item.appendix: (Pass Through Mode, Browsing Mode, etc.)
Karabiner turns off these modes automatically because
these modes are not suitable for password input.
This setting allows you to keep these modes's states.

item.name: Pass-Through caps lock LED status
item.appendix: Karabiner manipulates caps lock LED according to internal caps lock state.
(For example, if you changed right option key to caps lock,
LED will be toggled each time the right option key is pressed.)
However, some devices may become unstable by this LED manipulation.
Therefore, we provide an option to suppress this behavior.
Please turn on this option if your device does not work properly
when you changed a key to caps lock.

item.name: Don't restore modifiers in the mouse event
item.appendix: For example, when you use Option+Tab to Command+Tab,
we send "Command+Click" when you did a mouse click while
pushing the Option key after you pushed Option+Tab.
"Option+Click" should be output, but this option changes this behavior.

item.name: Disable NumPad Hack
item.appendix: (Don't change Fn+JKL.. to NumPad, and other Fn+key combinations)

item.name: Unlimited rapid key repeat rate
item.appendix: (Karabiner limits most rapid "Delay Until Repeat" to 200ms for safe.
This setting allows you unlimited "Delay Until Repeat".)

item.name: Ignore bouncing (chattering) events.
item.appendix: (Please adjust threshold in "Key Repeat" tab.)

item.name: Workaround for keyboards with stuck keys.
item.appendix: Enable this seting if you are using external keyboards
which sometimes keep pressing modifiers. (eg. shift)

item.name: Allow devices which Vendor ID and Product ID are zero.
item.appendix: (Be careful enabling this option.
These devices might cause system crash with Karabiner.)
